"Office works of the revenue and health department were taking place...A staff of our department found him hanging on the terrace and we alerted the police," official added. Police have registered a suspicious death case, the official stated.

175.title: In Gujarat, it's not only Hardik who is angry with Cong: Hardik Patel
175.article_body: In Gujarat, it’s not only Hardik Patel who is angry with the Congress, Patel, who resigned from the party on Wednesday, said. "There are many leaders and legislators in Gujarat who use Congress," Patel added. "Sitting in power and praising the party does not mean that the party can make them the CM," Patel stated.

176.title: 38-yr-old boxer Musa dies of heart attack after collapsing during match in Germany
176.article_body: Undefeated boxer Musa Yamak has died at the age of 38 after collapsing in the ring on Saturday while facing Uganda's Hamza Wandera in Munich. "We lost our compatriot Musa Askan Yamak, a boxer from Alucra, who won European and Asian championships, at a young age after a heart attack," Turkish official Hasan Turan announced.

177.title: Will help Sweden, Finland if they're attacked before joining NATO: Poland
177.article_body: Poland has said it will help Sweden and Finland if they are attacked before their NATO membership is finalised. "I want to make it clear that in the event of an attack on Sweden or Finland during their accession [process], Poland will come to their aid," said Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki. Sweden and Finland have formally applied for NATO membership.

178.title: 3 parakeets, over 120 other birds rescued from illegal sale bid in Pune
178.article_body: Pune City Police on Tuesday seized three exotic parakeets and over 120 other caged birds from a person in a crackdown over their illegal sale. On receiving a tip-off, police officials raided the accused's residence in the city's Ganesh Peth area and found these birds. The accused has been arrested and subsequently charged under the Wildlife Protection Act.

179.title: HC sets aside Delhi's doorstep ration delivery scheme, says it didn't have LG's nod
179.article_body: Delhi High Court on Thursday set aside the Aam Aadmi Party-led Delhi government's doorstep ration delivery scheme. The scheme did not have the approval of the Lieutenant Governor and the grains provided by the Centre cannot be used for this scheme, the court said. HC was hearing a plea by the Delhi Sarkari Ration Dealers Sangh challenging the scheme.

180.title: Ex-US Prez Bush mistakenly condemns 'brutal Iraq invasion' in Ukraine speech
180.article_body:
Former US President George W Bush mistakenly condemned the "brutal, unjustified invasion of Iraq" during a speech before correcting himself to say he was denouncing Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
Bush, who's 75, jokingly blamed the mistake on his age. Back in 2003, Bush announced an invasion of Iraq, claiming that the country was harbouring weapons of mass destruction and terrorists.

181.title: Big B, Rajesh Khanna's Anand gets a remake, fan says 'Don't spoil the film'
181.article_body: Late actor Rajesh Khanna and actor Amitabh Bachchan's film 'Anand' is being remade by original producer N.C. Sippy's grandson Sameer Raj Sippy and Vikram Khakhar. Speaking about remaking the original classic, producer Sameer Raj Sippy said that stories like these need to be narrated to the new generation. Reacting to the news, one user wrote, "Please don't spoil the film."

182.title: Sensex falls over 1,400 points to close at 52,792; TCS, Infosys shares tank 5%
182.article_body: The Sensex tanked 1,416 points on Thursday to close at 52,792, while the Nifty tanked 431 points to close at 15,809. The benchmark indices fell following heavy losses on Wall Street overnight. The IT stocks were the worst hit, with the shares of TCS and Infosys tanking by more than 5%.

183.title: Pope's 'need a tequila for my knee pain' video goes viral
183.article_body: A video of Pope Francis joking with Mexican seminarians about needing tequila to deal with pain in his knee has gone viral on social media. Pope Francis has been suffering from strained ligaments in his right knee for months and has been using a wheelchair. Seminarians promised to bring Pope Francis a bottle of tequila.

184.title: Gucci, Adidas face backlash for over ₹1 lakh umbrella that doesn't stop rain
184.article_body: Gucci and Adidas are facing backlash on social media over an umbrella that the companies are selling for 11,000 yuan (more than ₹1 lakh) in China. Gucci's China website states that the umbrella is "not waterproof and is meant for sun protection or decorative use". People posted tweets like, "You gotta be joking" and "Why make it then?"

185.title: SC to not review verdict on removal of Cyrus Mistry as Tata Sons head
185.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed a plea filed by the Shapoorji Pallonji Group seeking to review the court's earlier order approving the removal of Cyrus Mistry as Executive Chairman and Director of Tata Sons. The March 2021 order of the Supreme Court had overturned the NCLAT order which had reinstated Mistry as Tata Sons' Executive Chairman and Director.

186.title: Depp held dog out of car window & joked to put it in microwave: Amber's sister
186.article_body: Amber Heard's sister Whitney Henriquez alleged that Johnny Depp held their dog out of a car window in an incident back in 2013. "I was scared because...I knew how inebriated he was...the dog was...small," she said. She recalled Depp laughing after bringing the dog back in. "Then he made some joke about putting the dog in the microwave," she added.

187.title: Prof Karbhari Vishwanath takes additional charge of SPPU VC in Pune
187.article_body: Professor Karbhari Vishwanath Kale has been handed over the additional charge of the Vice-Chancellor of Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) as Professor Nitin Karmalkar's tenure ended. Professor Kale is the Vice-Chancellor of Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Technological University (BATU) in Maharashtra's Raigad district. He said, "I'll try to give maximum time as per the need in both the universities."

188.title: Russia sacked top commanders over Ukraine war failures: UK
188.article_body: The UK Defence Ministry said Russia has fired senior military commanders for underperforming in the Ukrainian war. Vice Admiral Igor Osipov, who commanded the Black Sea Fleet, was likely sacked following the sinking of the Moskva cruiser in April, it added. Russian Chief of General Staff Valeriy Gerasimov has likely lost Russian President Vladimir Putin's "confidence", the ministry said.

189.title: LIC share price down 11% from IPO price, falls for 3rd straight day
189.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) share price fell 4.12% to ₹840.25 on Thursday, taking the total drop in LIC's share price to 11.45% from its IPO issue price. The insurer's shares were listed on the stock market on Tuesday at a price of ₹867, against the IPO issue price of ₹949. The ₹21,000-crore public issue was oversubscribed nearly three times.

190.title: Pic shows Sidhu riding an elephant to protest rising prices before 1-yr jail verdict
190.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu rode an elephant in Punjab to protest against rising prices. Sharing pictures of the protest, Sidhu wrote, "Inflation devalues money of Farmers, Labourers, Middle class families, while earnings remain same." Sidhu was protesting before the Supreme Court sentenced him to one-year rigorous imprisonment in a three-decade-old road rage case.

191.title: Congress sidelined objectivity & prioritised subjectivity: Nadda
191.article_body: The Congress party is neither national, Indian nor democratic, BJP National President JP Nadda said on Thursday. "It (Congress) has reduced to 'bhai-behen' (brother-sister) party," Nadda added. "What has shrunk Congress is their activities. They sidelined objectivity and prioritised subjectivity...Such parties are BJP's threats. We are fighting them," Nadda stated.

192.title: 22-yr-old man booked under POCSO for raping 17-yr-old girl in Pune
192.article_body: A 22-year-old man was booked under the POCSO Act for allegedly raping and impregnating a 17-year-old girl in Pune. The girl's mother alleged that the victim was found 21 weeks pregnant after she complained of stomach ache to her, police said. The FIR has been lodged at the Bibvewadi Police Station.

193.title: Will submit to the majesty of law: Sidhu on being sentenced to 1-yr jail in road rage case
193.article_body: After being sentenced to one-year rigorous imprisonment by Supreme Court in a 1988 road rage case in which a man had died, Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu tweeted, "Will submit to the majesty of law." In 2018, the apex court had found Sidhu guilty of "voluntarily causing hurt" to a 65-year-old man, however, it had spared him a jail term.

194.title: We’re taking collective resolve to build new forward-looking India: PM
194.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said that collective efforts are being taken to build a new India. "Today we are taking a collective resolve, making efforts to build a new India whose identity is new, forward-looking and traditions are ancient and (to) move ahead by taking both new thinking and age-old culture together," PM Modi added while addressing 'Yuva Shivir'.

195.title: With no fatalities for a year, Gurugram's Eklavya Chowk out of 'black spots' list
195.article_body: Gurugram's Eklavya Chowk, formerly known as Hero Honda Chowk, was removed from the 'black spots' lists after no road fatalities were reported at this junction from April 2021 to April 2022. Gurugram traffic police implemented road safety measures at this Chowk after it was categorised under 'black spots' area in the city. 'Black spots' is referred to accident-prone locations.

196.title: Karnataka SSLC Class 10 board results declared, 145 students score 100% marks
196.article_body: The Karnataka Secondary Education Examination Board on Thursday announced the Class 10 SSLC results. As many as 85.63% of over eight lakh students have cleared the exams. Out of this, 145 students have secured 100% marks and 1.18 lakh students have got Grade A+. The pass percentage for girls was recorded at 90.29%, while it was 81.3% for boys.

197.title: Massive fire breaks out in Delhi's Bawana, 17 fire tenders reach spot
197.article_body: A massive fire broke out in a manufacturing unit of a factory in Delhi's Bawana Industrial Area on Thursday. Delhi Fire Services Director Atul Garg said a call about the fire was received at 11:45 am, following which 17 fire tenders were rushed to the spot. The cause of the fire is not yet known and rescue operation is underway.

198.title: 1 killed, 6 injured as fire breaks out at electric items factory in Delhi
198.article_body: At least one person died and six others were injured on Thursday after a fire broke out at a factory in Delhi's Mustafabad area, officials said. Seven fire tenders were rushed to the spot, officials added. "The fire broke out on the first floor of a factory manufacturing electric items," Fire Department Director Atul Garg said.

199.title: We are seeing transmission among men having sex with men: WHO on monkeypox
199.article_body: With health authorities in North America and Europe detecting dozens of suspected or confirmed cases of monkeypox since early May, WHO has warned that monkeypox may spread through sexual contact. "We are seeing transmission among men having sex with men," said WHO Assistant Director-General Dr Soce Fall. "This is new information we need to investigate properly," Fall added.

200.title: Teacher assaults 18-year-old student over fake social media profile in Pune
200.article_body: An 18-year-old student was assaulted by his teacher and associates at a school in Pune after the former allegedly created a fake social media profile of the teacher. The student had allegedly posted some pornographic text on the profile as well, police said. Notably, the lady teacher has been booked under Section 352 of the IPC.

201.title: Karnataka to get AIIMS, assures Health Minister Mandaviya
201.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has assured the Karnataka government that an AIIMS will be established in the state. The assurance was given during Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar's meeting with Mandaviya, according to a report. The move will greatly benefit the state and further enhance the state's health and medical education, said Sudhakar.

202.title: Video of man laughing uncontrollably during Amber Heard-Depp's trial goes viral
202.article_body: Recently, a video has gone viral online where a court observer couldn't control his laughter during the Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's defamation trial. The video is from Tuesday when Amber was being questioned about her allegations of assault against ex-husband Depp. The man walked out of the courtroom after multiple objections from Depp's attorney Camille Vasquez.

203.title: Owaisi was mum when 2 mosques were demolished in Hyd: Amit Malviya
203.article_body: BJP's Amit Malviya criticised AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi over his remarks on Gyanvapi mosque case and said that he is "communalising" the issue. Owaisi didn't utter a word when two mosques in Hyderabad were demolished to build Secretariat, Malviya added. "Owaisi is not just a communal bigot but a hypocrite who peddles lies planted with fascist media," he further said.

204.title: He mocked Hindu 'aastha': BJP on Akhilesh's remark on temples
204.article_body: Reacting to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's remark on temples, BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla said, "Akhilesh Yadav, who claims that Shri Krishna comes in his dreams, has mocked the Hindu aastha (faith)." Poonawalla's statement comes after the ex-UP CM said, "Just by placing a rock, a red flag under a pipal tree it becomes a temple in the Hindu religion."

205.title: Andhra man looking for wife stabs mother-in-law to death
205.article_body: A man looking for his wife, who had left him months ago, allegedly stabbed his mother-in-law to death in Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada district. The accused, identified as Ramesh, killed the victim after he couldn't find his wife at her place. Ramesh's wife, who was away studying in Hyderabad, had left him as he doubted her, according to police.

206.title: Thieves break open ATM using gas cutters in Virar; steal ₹17 lakh
206.article_body: Unidentified thieves allegedly broke open an ATM using gas cutters and stole ₹17 lakh in Phoolpada in Virar East on Wednesday, a report stated. The incident came to light when locals saw the damaged ATM and informed the police about the matter. Meanwhile, police have launched an investigation and are examining CCTV footage of the area to arrest the accused.

207.title: Hyderabad auto driver sentenced to life imprisonment for wife's murder
207.article_body: An auto driver was sentenced to life imprisonment for murdering his wife by Hyderabad's LB Nagar court. The convict, Ramavath Sreenu (43), was found guilty of murdering his wife over an argument at their home in a Ranga Reddy district's village in March 2021. Notably, Sreenu was in a drunken state when he attacked his wife, the court said.

208.title: Tesla vehicle crash that killed three under probe in US
208.article_body: The US NHTSA is investigating a crash involving a Tesla that may have been operating in Autopilot during a crash that killed three people. The vehicle had hit a curb and slammed into construction equipment. This is one of 35 crashes under investigation by NHTSA involving Tesla vehicles in which its Autopilot was suspected of being used since 2016.

209.title: Follow rules or leave India: Government to VPN providers
209.article_body: VPN service providers that are not ready to comply with the new guidelines have the only option to exit from India, MoS for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said. "If you don't have the logs, start maintaining the logs. If you are a VPN that wants to hide...then frankly you have no other opportunity but to pull out," he said.

210.title: Pune's Ashok Dyalchand nominated for World's Children's Prize award for decade
210.article_body: Pune resident Ashok Dyalchand has been nominated for the World's Children's Prize Decade Child Rights Hero award which is given by the World's Children's Prize Foundation. The 74-year-old activist is among the eight nominees, including Ghana's Kofi Annan and Pakistan's Malala Yousafzai, selected for the award. Notably, Ashok campaigns against child marriages through his institute in India.

211.title: Goa-bound SpiceJet flight returns to Pune following technical glitch
211.article_body: A Goa-bound SpiceJet aircraft, which took off from Pune's Lohegaon airport on Wednesday, returned to the city shortly after takeoff following technical glitch mid-air. The flight, which took off at 12:05 pm from Pune, landed back safely at the city's airport, the airline's spokesperson said. The cause of the glitch, however, has not yet been confirmed by the airline.

212.title: BJP 'misusing' central agencies: Mamata over SSC recruitment scam
212.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday accused the BJP of "misusing" central agencies for settling political scores amid the irregularities in SSC appointments. "If someone has committed any wrong...then law will take its own course," Banerjee said, claiming there were many discrepancies in government recruitment during the erstwhile Left Front regime, details of which she would "reveal soon".

213.title: In Bangladesh, people compare me to Bradman when I score a century: Mushfiqur Rahim
213.article_body: Mushfiqur Rahim, who became the first Bangladesh batter to reach 5,000 Test runs, said in Bangladesh, people compare him to Don Bradman when he scores a century. "But...when I don't score runs...I feel like digging a hole for myself," he added, referring to the criticism he faces. "This is becoming a culture...so the younger players need the support," Rahim stated.

214.title: Navjot Singh Sidhu gets 1-year jail in 3-decade-old road rage case in which a man died
214.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday sentenced Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu to one year in jail in a three-decade-old road rage case in which a man was killed. The court delivered its order on the review petition filed by victim's family. The former cricketer had argued that there was "ambiguity" regarding the actual cause of death of the victim.

215.title: 55 space startups have registered with ISRO in 2 yrs: Govt
215.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh has announced that 55 registered startup proposals were approved in the last two years under ISRO's decision to open up its services and partnerships to the private sector. He expects at least another nine proposals to be completed in 2022-23. He also announced that 75 students' satellites are set to be launched this year.

216.title: Bengaluru's RBD layout to get new drain to flush out rainwater
216.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike will soon construct a drain on a public-private partnership model to carry rainwater from Rainbow Drive (RBD) layout to Sarjapur culvert, Mahadevapura MLA Aravind Limbavali said, visiting the rain-affected area. Residents of RBD layout had written to Limbavali on May 10, seeking a solution to the recurrent flooding problems in the area during the rainy season.

217.title: Man gives triple talaq to Chhattisgarh woman over phone
217.article_body: A woman was allegedly given triple talaq in Chhattisgarh by her husband over the phone for purportedly not giving birth to a child. A case has been registered in the matter. "She was tortured by her husband and father-in-law for not giving birth to a child," Bhaskar Sharma, SHO, Kunkuri, said. The woman was staying at her maternal home.

218.title: CARS24 fires 600 employees citing 'poor performance'
218.article_body: Pre-owned cars platform CARS24 on Thursday said that around 600 of its employees have been let go based on their "poor performance" and not owing to any "cost cuts". The company said, "This is business as usual as these are performance-linked exits that happen every year." The company also said that it's in the process of hiring more people globally.

219.title: 14-year-old boy arrested for raping woman with special needs in Pune
219.article_body: A 14-year-old boy has been arrested for allegedly raping a 23-year-old woman with special needs in Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad. "The teenager suspect raped the woman on two occasions, on May 16 and 18, when her family members were not home," a police officer said. The boy will be produced before the Juvenile Justice Board for further action, the officer added.

220.title: China eases COVID-19 test rules for US, other countries
220.article_body: China has relaxed COVID-19 testing requirements for travellers from some countries, including US, Canada, UAE, Serbia and Bangladesh. Travellers from the US will no longer need an RT-PCR test seven days before flying, according to the Chinese embassy in the US. They will, however, still have to take two RT-PCR tests within 48 or 24 hours of their flights.

221.title: J&K Police arrest 5 for terror attack on wine shop in Baramulla
221.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Thursday said they have arrested four terrorists and one LeT associate in connection with the terror attack on a wine shop in Baramulla. Police also recovered five pistols, 23 grenades and other explosives from the accused. According to IGP (Kashmir) Vijay Kumar, this terror module was involved in several incidents in the Baramulla area.

222.title: Former Punjab Congress president Sunil Jakhar joins BJP
222.article_body: Senior Congress leader and former chief of Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee (PPCC) Sunil Jakhar on Thursday joined BJP in presence of party president JP Nadda in Delhi. He quit Congress during a Facebook live broadcast on Saturday. Jakhar resigned weeks after party leadership had issued him a show-cause notice over his criticism of former Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi.

223.title: UP court allows lawsuit seeking removal of Shahi Idgah Mosque near Krishna Janmabhoomi
223.article_body: A court in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura on Thursday allowed a lawsuit seeking removal of the Shahi Idgah Masjid from the Krishna Janmabhoomi, informed lawyer Hari Shankar Jain to PTI. The lawsuit seeks the removal of the 17th century Shahi Idgah Masjid from the Katra Keshav Dev Temple, claiming the mosque has been built at the birthplace of Lord Krishna.

224.title: Few people are using it to settle personal scores: Gulshan on nepotism debate
224.article_body: After Zoya Akhtar’s ‘The Archies’ reignited nepotism debate, actor Gulshan Devaiah shared his opinion on it. He tweeted, “The nepotism debate harnesses the angst...many have from within and outside the Hindi entertainment industry to serve the interests of a few who use it to settle personal scores.” “Film production is a private business. It’s not based on merit,” Gulshan added.

225.title: 19-yr-old who tracks Musk's jet claims he has found Zuckerberg's new aircraft
225.article_body: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old who tracks Elon Musk's jet, on Wednesday tweeted, "We've found Mark Zuckerberg's jet N68885. Numerous trips point it being his." Sweeney shared a picture of the aircraft. In February, Sweeney began tracking and sharing updates on what he said was Zuckerberg's private jet. In April, he said the aircraft was no longer being used by Zuckerberg.

226.title: IMD issues orange alert in 12 of 14 districts in Kerala amid heavy rains
226.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert in 12 of 14 districts in Kerala amid heavy rains. The alert was issued in all districts except Thiruvananthapuram and Kollam for Thursday. The cyclonic circulation over northern Tamil Nadu and adjoining areas would lead to isolated very heavy rainfall in several parts of Kerala, the state Disaster Management Authority said.

227.title: Sri Lanka CID interrogates 4 MPs over violence during protests
227.article_body: Sri Lanka Police's Criminal Investigation Department (CID) on Wednesday questioned four Members of Parliament (MPs) over the violence amid protests owing to the economic crisis. Many protesters were allegedly attacked by government supporters in Colombo. The CID recorded statements of ex-ministers Rohitha Abeygunawardena and CB Rathnayake and MPs Sahan Pradeep and Sanjeeva Edirimanna.

228.title: Getty Images to launch NFTs derived from its library of 465 mn images
228.article_body: Getty Images has entered into an agreement with Candy Digital to develop a diverse portfolio of NFT products and collections. The NFTs will be derived from the platform's library of "more than 465 million images", including over 135 million analogue images from Getty Images' photographic archive. Many of the analogue archival photographs have never been seen before by the public.

229.title: No improvement in J&K's security after Article 370 abrogation: Omar Abdullah
229.article_body: National Conference Vice President Omar Abdullah on Wednesday said there has been no improvement in the security situation in Jammu and Kashmir following the abrogation of Articles 370 and 35A. While reacting to the targeted killings in the union territory, the former J&K CM said, "In this week, three such killings took place. After every few weeks, this phenomenon restarts."

230.title: Speak truth in Cong and big leaders will defame you: Hardik Patel
230.article_body: A day after resigning from Congress, Hardik Patel criticised the party and said that the strategy of big leaders in Congress is to defame the one who speaks the truth. "There are discussions in party that people will vote for Congress when they get bored," he added. "I decided to leave party not with sadness but courage," Hardik further said.

231.title: Doctor arrested for running sex determination centre in Ludhiana
231.article_body: An Ayurvedic lady doctor was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly running an illegal sex determination centre in Ludhiana's Rishi Nagar. A raid was conducted following complaints that people from across Punjab and Haryana were getting sex detection tests done at the centre, health department officials said. The doctor had been running the centre for around one-and-a-half years, officials stated.

232.title: US charges 1 American, 4 Chinese intel officers with spying
232.article_body: The US charged an American citizen and four Chinese intelligence officers with spying on Chinese dissidents, human rights leaders, and pro-democracy activists residing in the country. American citizen, Wang Shujun, was arrested on March 16 and will be arraigned at a later date, but the four officials of China's Ministry of State Security remain at large, US Justice Department said.

233.title: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik convicted in terror funding case in Delhi
233.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik has been convicted in 2017 terror funding case by an NIA court in Delhi after he pleaded guilty, ANI reported. The court also sought an affidavit from Malik regarding his financial assessment and asked NIA to submit a report related to his financial assessment. Argument on sentence will take place on May 25.

234.title: Ambala man kills 52-yr-old neighbour with hammer following argument
234.article_body: A 52-year-old woman was allegedly murdered by her neighbour after she asked him to repair his shed in Ambala’s Saha town on Wednesday. According to the deceased woman’s son, the 28-year-old accused hit the victim’s head with a hammer following an altercation with her regarding the shed. The accused managed to escape.

235.title: China building 'larger' bridge on Pangong Tso lake; satellite image released
235.article_body: China is constructing a "larger" second bridge on Pangong Tso lake which is capable of carrying military vehicles and armoured columns, according to satellite imagery and people familiar with the development. The new bridge is being built from both sides simultaneously. The Pangong Tso has witnessed tensions between India and China since May 2020.

236.title: How can RCB qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs?
236.article_body: Fifth-placed RCB will face GT in IPL 2022 tonight. RCB have the worst net run-rate among teams still in contention for playoffs spots. RCB will go fourth on the table with a win over GT. However, they'd need MI to defeat DC to advance. If DC defeat MI, RCB would all likely fail to qualify due to inferior net run-rate.

237.title: It's a natural geologic feature: NASA after pic of 'door' on Mars goes viral
237.article_body: After a pic appearing to show a "door" on Mars went viral, NASA's Curiosity Rover tweeted "Some of you have noticed this image I took...Sure, it may look like a tiny door, but really, it's a natural geologic feature!" "It may just look like a door because your mind is trying to make sense of the unknown," it wrote.

238.title: Only Deepika & I were in sarees at Cannes, attracted a lot of attention: Namita
238.article_body: Actress-producer Namita Lal spoke about her experience of visiting the Cannes Film Festival. She said, "The red carpet was just amazing." Speaking about meeting Deepika Padukone, Namita said, "Deepika was dressed in an amazing saree and was looking stunning. I was in a saree too...We were the only two people in a saree and we attracted a lot of attention."

239.title: J&K govt creates ₹500 cr Film Development Fund for 5 yrs
239.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir government has created Film Development Fund (FDF) of ₹500 crore to be payable in next five years to financially support the development of a vibrant film ecosystem in the valley. According to the Film Policy, the amount will be used for disbursement of subsidies to eligible beneficiaries or film-makers who have applied for the same.

240.title: Rinku Singh tears up as KKR lose to LSG by 2 runs, pics go viral
240.article_body: KKR's Rinku Singh teared up after his team lost to LSG by two runs and failed to qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs. Needing 21 runs to win off the last over, Rinku slammed 18 runs on the first four deliveries before getting caught out on the fifth ball. LSG dismissed Umesh Yadav on the last ball to win the match.

241.title: SC grants interim bail to SP leader Azam Khan in cheating case
241.article_body: Supreme Court has granted interim bail to jailed Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Azam Khan in a cheating case citing "unusual facts" presented before it. SC directed Khan to apply for regular bail before the concerned court within a period of two weeks. The case is related to alleged land grabbing and forgery related to a school in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur.

242.title: Upset over UP govt's order, Mathura lawyers observe strike
242.article_body: After the Uttar Pradesh government issued an order directing all district magistrates to take action against lawyers creating lawlessness in the state's district courts, the lawyers in Mathura observed a strike on Wednesday. The lawyers abstained from work due to the derogatory language allegedly used in the order against the lawyers' community, Bar Association President Ajeet Teharia said.

243.title: Bezos' Blue Origin delays 5th crewed spaceflight over technical issues
243.article_body: Jeff Bezos-owned Blue Origin delayed its fifth crewed spaceflight due to technical issues. The launch was scheduled for May 20. "During our final vehicle check-outs, we observed one of New Shepard's back-up systems was not meeting our expectations for performance," the firm said. Blue Origin's fourth flight landed successfully in March after a 10-minute journey to the edge of space.

244.title: Auto driver killed, woman passenger injured in hit-and-run case in Bandra
244.article_body: A 30-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was killed and a woman passenger travelling in his vehicle was injured after a heavy vehicle hit the three-wheeler in Mumbai's Bandra (West). The incident took place on Tuesday night. While the auto driver's body was found lying on the road in a decapitated state, the injured woman had left the spot in another auto-rickshaw.

245.title: Aurangzeb's tomb shut for 5 days to maintain law and order: Maha Deputy CM
245.article_body: Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb in Aurangabad will remain closed for five days to ensure that the law and order situation in Maharashtra does not get affected, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. This comes after a mosque committee in the area tried to lock the place. Notably, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena spokesperson Gajanan Kale had said that the tomb should be destroyed.

246.title: India has become third largest startup ecosystem globally: PM Modi
246.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi in his address to the Yuva Shivir in Gujarat praised India's progress, saying, "Today, India has become third largest startup ecosystem in the world." He also praised India's participation in tackling worldwide challenges. "Today, we are working to build a new India which has a new forward-looking identity, but maintains its ancient traditions," he added.

247.title: 100 red sandalwood logs seized in Andhra Pradesh, 6 smugglers arrested
247.article_body: Andhra Pradesh's Kadapa Police on Wednesday arrested six people for illegally smuggling red sandalwood logs. About 100 logs of red sandalwood weighing 2 tonnes were seized from the accused, said Kadapa Superintendent of Police (SP) Anburajan. According to police, the apprehended persons were involved in illegally transporting red sanders from Andhra Pradesh to Chennai.

248.title: Yogi Cabinet accepts proposal to stop grants to new madrasas in UP
248.article_body: Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh Cabinet has accepted a proposal to stop grants to any new madrasas in the state. The old madrasas getting the funds would continue to do so. "The idea is to focus on quality than quantity...we plan to focus on the quality of the existing ones," UP Minister of State for Minority Welfare Danish Azad Ansari said.

249.title: US embassy reopens in Ukraine's Kyiv after nearly 3 months
249.article_body: The US embassy resumed its operations after nearly three months in war-torn Ukraine's Kyiv on Wednesday. The consular operations, however, won't start immediately and a no-travel advisory issued earlier will remain in place, said an official. "We stand proudly with the government and people of Ukraine as they bravely defend their country," said US Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

250.title: Japan to double fiscal support for Ukraine to $600 million
250.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said the country will double its fiscal support for Ukraine to $600 million in a coordinated move with World Bank to back the country's near-term fiscal necessities damaged by Russia's invasion. "Our country stands with Ukraine," Kishida added. Japan, a member of the G7, had previously announced $300 million in loans to Ukraine in April.

251.title: N Korea has completed preparations for nuclear test, waiting for best moment: S Korea
251.article_body: North Korea has completed preparations for a nuclear test and is seeking the best moment to carry it out, South Korean lawmaker Ha Tae-keung said citing information from the national spy agency. Earlier, US said it believes there is a "genuine possibility" that North Korea could conduct a nuclear test while President Joe Biden is on his Asia trip.

252.title: Virat Kohli gifts Rashid Khan his bat ahead of their match, Rashid shares video
252.article_body: GT vice-captain Rashid Khan took to Instagram to share a video of him with RCB's Virat Kohli after the latter gifted him his bat ahead of their IPL 2022 clash. "Always a pleasure meeting you...Thank you for the gift," Rashid wrote. Commenting on Rashid's post, SRH pacer Fazalhaq Farooqi wrote, "Two kings of cricket." Meanwhile, presenter Erin Holland wrote, "Superstars."

253.title: Stop printing textbooks with RSS founder's talk: Siddaramaiah to K'taka CM
253.article_body: Reacting to reports of inclusion of RSS founder KB Hedgewar's speech in Karnataka school textbooks, Congress leader Siddaramaiah told Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to immediately stop the printing of the textbooks. He further asked Bommai to take decision in this regard after discussions with intellectuals and experts. "Do not politicise education for selfish reasons," the ex-Karnataka CM added.

254.title: SC asks UP court not to proceed with Gyanvapi Mosque case today, will hear matter tomorrow
254.article_body: The Supreme Court has asked the trial court in Varanasi not to proceed with the Gyanvapi Mosque case till Friday. The Supreme Court will hear the case at 3 pm tomorrow. Vishnu Shankar Jain, advocate of the Hindu side, told the Supreme Court that senior advocate Hari Shankar Jain is not well and requested it to hear the case tomorrow.

255.title: Russia uses new laser weapons in Ukraine, Zelenskyy mocks 'wonder weapon'
255.article_body: Russia has said it is using a new generation of powerful lasers in Ukraine to burn up drones. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy mockingly compared news of the lasers to the "wonder weapon" that Nazi Germany unveiled in a bid to prevent defeat in World War II. Russia's move "clearly indicates the complete failure of the invasion", Zelenskyy said.

256.title: Ridiculous: Cathie Wood on Tesla being cut from S&P 500 ESG Index
256.article_body: Ark Invest's Cathie Wood in response to Tesla being cut from the S&P 500 ESG Index, said, "Ridiculous. Not worthy of any other response." Responding to Wood, Musk wrote, "Yup. A clear case of wacktivism." "What I love most about wacktivists is their incredible sense of humour," he wrote in another tweet later.

257.title: How long can you hide truth?: RSS leader on Gyanvapi case
257.article_body: Speaking about the Gyanvapi Mosque case, RSS leader Sunil Ambekar said that facts should be allowed to come out. "Facts are coming out…In any case, truth always finds a way out. How long can you hide it?" Ambekar added. "I believe it's time we put historical facts in the right perspective before society," Ambekar stated.

258.title: Jaipur traffic policeman damages car’s windshield as driver jumps red light
258.article_body: A car’s windshield was damaged as a traffic policeman hit it with a stick after the driver jumped a red light in Jaipur’s Rambagh crossing on Wednesday, police said. A woman and a minor girl were also travelling in the car. Following the incident, a ruckus was created there. "Seven persons were arrested from the spot," a police official said.

259.title: Gyanvapi Mosque video survey report submitted in sealed cover in Varanasi court
259.article_body: The court-appointed Commission that conducted the video survey of the Gyanvapi Mosque complex has filed its report in a sealed cover in the Varanasi court on Thursday. Earlier, the Supreme Court had asked Varanasi District Magistrate to protect the area where the Shivling was claimed to have been found without affecting the right of Muslims to enter mosque and worship.

260.title: You call yourself sh*tposter, maybe you're wiseposter: Bezos to DOGE co-creator
260.article_body: Amazon's Jeff Bezos in response to a tweet by Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus said, "Seen you refer to yourself as...sh*tposter but maybe you're mostly just a wiseposter." Markus had tweeted about how Democrats and Republicans could pull more people to their side. Markus thanked Bezos and said he's addicted to dopamine and his tweets are just random thoughts he has.

261.title: Attempt to create panic: WB CM on Maoists posters in Jhargram
261.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that the posters put up with names of Maoists in Jhargram district are an attempt to create panic among the people. "Someone has been putting up handwritten posters claiming that it had been done by Maoists," Banerjee added. "There has been a continuous campaign and I think it must be investigated," Banerjee further said.

262.title: Katrina, Alia & I decided we want to do film together: Priyanka on Jee Le Zara
262.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra spoke about why she said yes to Farhan Akhtar's project, 'Jee Le Zara', which also stars actresses Katrina Kaif and Alia Bhatt. Priyanka said, "Katrina and Alia are two of the top actresses in the country." "The three of us decided we wanted to do a movie together and partner together to produce it," Priyanka said.

263.title: Shops in Mumbai to use Marathi signboards in Devanagari by May 31: BMC
263.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has directed all shops and establishments in Mumbai to predominantly use Marathi signboards in Devanagari script by May 31. While using more than one script, the Marathi-Devanagari script font cannot be smaller than that of other scripts, it added. Liquor shops or bars must not bear the names of legendary personalities and historical forts, BMC stated.

264.title: 65-year-old woman arrested for kidnapping 5-year-old boy in Thane
264.article_body: A 65-year-old woman has been arrested for allegedly kidnapping a five-year-old boy in Maharashtra's Thane district with the aim of selling him. The boy was kidnapped from near his house in Mafatlal slum area in Thane's Kalwa at around 10 pm on May 14. Police traced the woman within 48 hours and handed over the child to his parents.

265.title: Belarus introduces death penalty for 'attempted terrorism'
265.article_body: The Belarusian government has made 'attempted terrorism' punishable by death. President Alexander Lukashenko cleared the amendments to the criminal code, which will come into force on May 29. Earlier, death sentence was reserved for acts of terrorism that resulted in death or murder. Notably, several opposition leaders have been charged with terrorism over anti-government protests in 2020.

266.title: Kerala Cong chief booked for remarks against CM Pinarayi Vijayan
266.article_body: The KPCC President K Sudhakaran was booked by the Palarivattom Police in Kochi for his "dog with broken chain" remark allegedly made on CM Pinarayi Vijayan. The police have booked Sudhakaran under Section 153 of the IPC based on the complaint made by a Democratic Youth Federation of India leader. Notably, LDF has termed Sudhakaran's remark as "highly reprehensible".

267.title: Depp grabbed Amber by hair and whacked her repeatedly in the face: Heard's sister
267.article_body: Actress Amber Heard's sister Whitney Henriquez, while testifying in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against Heard, said Depp once grabbed Amber by the hair and whacked her repeatedly in the face. She said that she witnessed their fight at their penthouse in March 2015. She further claimed that Depp asked her to sign a non-disclosure agreement after the incident.

268.title: 20-year-old dies by suicide after boyfriend blocks her on WhatsApp in Mumbai: Police
268.article_body: A 20-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide at her boyfriend's house in Mumbai after he blocked her number on WhatsApp following an argument with her, police said. Inspector Anil Kadam said police have seized their mobile phones. He added, "Prima facie it appears that the woman was extremely possessive about her boyfriend and her boyfriend was unhappy with this possessiveness."

269.title: Spain's ex-King Juan Carlos to return home after 2-year exile
269.article_body: Spain's ex-King Juan Carlos will return to the country on Thursday after nearly two years in exile in the UAE, the Royal Household said. He had left Spain amid allegations of corruption. But, three investigations against the 84-year-old were dropped in March, paving the way for him to return. Carlos abdicated in 2014 and handed power to his son Felipe.

270.title: US invokes wartime act amid baby formula shortage
270.article_body: US President Joe Biden has invoked the 1950 Defense Production Act to make companies produce vital baby formula ingredients as part of a number of new measures to lessen the ongoing national baby formula shortage. It was first enacted to avoid wartime shortages. The Defense Production Act also lets the President prohibit hoarding and profiteering from certain materials.

271.title: 12-year-old dies in Noida days after trying to imitate Superman
271.article_body: A 12-year-old boy died in Noida days after he was recording video of himself posing as Superman by tying a cloth as cape around his neck. The boy, Surjeet, was standing atop a wooden box barely two feet in height. While trying to jump from the box, his cape got entangled, tightening the noose around his neck and he collapsed.

272.title: Policeman, his friend held over gang-rape of 17-year-old girl in UP
272.article_body: A 24-year-old police constable and his friend were arrested in connection with the alleged gang-rape of a 17-year-old girl, Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh Police said. The incident came to light after videos of the alleged sexual assault shot by the accused went viral, police added. The constable called her to a place after promising to marry her, the victim's mother claimed.

273.title: Hurriyat Conference calls for Kashmir bandh on May 21
273.article_body: The Hurriyat Conference on Wednesday called for Kashmir bandh on May 21 to pay tributes to Maulvi Mohammad Farooq Shah and Abdul Ghani Lone on their death anniversary. The separatist outfit asked people to visit Eidgah and offer prayers to the leaders. The group further condemned the continued detention of its members since August 2019 when Article 370 was abrogated.

274.title: Activists urge govt to make report on Hyderabad's Mecca Masjid blast public
274.article_body: Around 46 activists have urged the Telangana government to make public the Justice Bhaskar Rao Commission's report on the police firing at the mob during the 2007 Mecca Masjid bomb blast incident in Hyderabad. Notably, five civilians were killed during the police firing. The activists have also demanded government intervention in ensuring justice for the bereaved families.

275.title: Thought I'd get many offers post 'Lipstick...', but it didn't happen: Plabita
275.article_body: Speaking about her journey in the industry, actress Plabita Borthakur said, "There have been times when I was doing well...I'd do...two ads and my month would be sorted. And then 'Lipstick Under My Burkha' happened." "But...[the film] didn't release for three years...and then [when it] released, I thought I'd be surrounded by offers but that [didn't] happen," she added.

276.title: Russia to legalise crypto as means of payment 'sooner or later'
276.article_body: Russia's Industry and Trade Minister Denis Manturov has said the country will be legalising cryptocurrency as a means of payment "sooner or later". "The question is, when this happens, how it will be regulated, now that the central bank and government are actively working on it," he added. Russia has plans to issue its own digital rouble.

277.title: Losing any valuable party member diminishes us: Tharoor on Hardik’s exit
277.article_body: Reacting to Hardik Patel’s exit from Congress, party leader Shashi Tharoor said that it’s a loss for Congress. "Losing any valuable party member diminishes us," Tharoor added. "I am very disappointed…because I've met him and been impressed by the young man as somebody who has a lot of passion, intelligence and the ability to make very effective contributions," Tharoor stated.

278.title: Doctors at Delhi's Lady Hardinge stop work over assault incident
278.article_body: Resident doctors of Delhi's Lady Hardinge Medical College announced withdrawal from all services, including emergency, from 9 am on Thursday after a patient's relative assaulted some doctors. In a letter to the hospital administration, they said some resident doctors, including one female doctor, were intimidated and assaulted on May 18. They demanded an FIR and arrest of culprits immediately.

279.title: Price of domestic LPG cylinder crosses ₹1,000-mark as rate goes up by ₹3.50
279.article_body: The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder was hiked by ₹3.50 on Thursday, in the second such move this month. With this, the cost of a cylinder now crosses the ₹1,000-mark, according to ANI. With the price rise, a domestic LPG cylinder will cost ₹1,003 in Delhi and Mumbai, ₹1,029 in Kolkata, and ₹1,018.5 in Chennai from today.

280.title: Sensex tanks 1,000 points, Nifty dips below 16,000-mark
280.article_body: Domestic equity market benchmarks Sensex and Nifty tumbled nearly 2% in early trade on Thursday. Sensex tanked over 1,000 points, giving up 54,000 level, while Nifty plunged over 300 points, giving up 16,000. Barring ITC, all Sensex shares opened in the red today. Meanwhile, the Indian rupee opened 11 paise lower at 77.69 against the US dollar.

281.title: India reports 2,364 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 15,419
281.article_body: India has reported 2,364 COVID-19 cases, 2,582 recoveries and 10 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 1,829 COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 15,419, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,303.

282.title: ED books Raj Kundra for money laundering in porn videos case
282.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has registered a money laundering case against actress Shilpa Shetty's husband and businessman Raj Kundra in connection with the production and circulation of pornography films. Kundra was arrested by Mumbai Police in 2021 for allegedly running a porn racket with operations outside India as well. ED will probe into the financial transaction pertaining to the case.

283.title: Lot depends on how it unfolds in few months: Tharoor on 'Chintan Shivir'
283.article_body: Speaking about Congress’ 'Chintan Shivir', party leader Shashi Tharoor said it’s the beginning of an important process but a lot depends on how it unfolds over the next few months. "I think if people within the party feel there is a change, we'll also be able to see it in a renewed burst of energy in the party," Tharoor added.

284.title: 25-year-old man poses as cable operator, robs houses in Pune; held
284.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for posing as personnel of an internet or cable service provider and robbing residential societies in Pune. The suspect, who is from Aurangabad, used to travel to Pune just for the robberies and targeted flats after thoroughly conducting a recce of the area, police said. Several stolen laptops and gold ornaments were recovered from him.

285.title: We keep naughty women at home: Taliban on women afraid to leave homes under its rule
285.article_body: When asked about women who say they are afraid to go out of their homes under Taliban rule, Afghanistan's acting interior minister and Taliban's co-deputy leader Sirajuddin Haqqani said, "We keep naughty women at home." "It was a joke referring to those naughty women who are controlled by some other sides to bring the current government into question," he added.

286.title: Action to be taken if unnecessary loudspeakers are installed: UP CM
286.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said action will be taken against the officials if complaints are received of "unnecessary" loudspeakers being installed and played loudly anywhere in the state. "The noise of loudspeakers should be within the premises where they are installed. We have set this example with amity. In the future also, such a situation should prevail," CM Yogi added.

287.title: Villagers in Himachal's Spiti oppose survey for gypsum mining
287.article_body: Villagers of Gue, located in Himachal Pradesh's Lahaul and Spiti, opposed survey of gypsum in the area fearing that government will lease out the sites to private companies. Gypsum is a mineral used in manufacturing fertilisers and cement, besides cosmetic products. As per the villagers, mining will have an adverse impact on the ecology as well as their culture.

288.title: Class 12 student attacked outside school in Delhi's Sultanpuri
288.article_body: A class 12 student of a government school was attacked with belts and knives outside his school in outer Delhi's Sultanpuri on Wednesday afternoon. The victim was walking out of the school after his examination when three-four boys attacked him, police said. The victim suffered a deep cut over his head and a stab wound on his thigh, police added.

289.title: Delhi govt likely to flag off 100 electric buses next week: Report
289.article_body: The Delhi government will likely flag off nearly 100 electric buses next week, media reports cited officials as saying. The government has received a batch of over 100 electric buses. While the ones planned to be flagged off next week are fully integrated, the remaining buses are still being integrated. There are two e-bus depots to house these buses.

290.title: Over 300 buses stay off-road in Mumbai as BEST staff go on strike
290.article_body: Over 300 mini buses remained off roads in Mumbai on Wednesday as the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) staff went on a flash strike for the second consecutive day. The strike was called by the BEST staff over non-payment of salaries and provident fund. The bus operations at Bandra, Vikhroli and Kurla depots were badly affected, BEST officials said.

291.title: Wheat shouldn't go the way of COVID-19 vaccines: India calls out West on exports at UN
291.article_body: Calling out the West, India said that wheat should not go the way of the COVID-19 vaccines as it voiced concern over hoarding and discrimination amid the "unjustified increase" in food prices at the UN. "It is necessary for all of us to adequately appreciate the importance of equity, affordability and accessibility when it comes to food grains," India said.

292.title: US reports its 1st case of monkeypox this year
292.article_body: The US on Wednesday confirmed a case of monkeypox in a man who had recently travelled to Canada. It is the first monkeypox case reported in the country this year. "The case poses no risk to the public, and the individual is hospitalised and in good condition," the Massachusetts Department of Health said in a statement.

293.title: 3 killed as truck runs over sleeping migrant labourers in Haryana's Jhajjar
293.article_body: At least three migrant labourers died and 11 others were severely injured after a truck ran over them on Kundli-Manesar-Palwal Expressway in Haryana's Jhajjar district on Thursday morning. The migrant labourers were sleeping by the roadside near a toll plaza when the truck lost control and ran over them. Ten of the injured have been taken to Rohtak's PGIMS.

294.title: Kashmiri Pandits will not be posted in vulnerable areas: Official
294.article_body: Kashmir Divisional Commissioner Pandurang K Pole on Wednesday said he has directed all heads of the government departments to ensure that Kashmiri Pandit employees are not posted in vulnerable areas. He said they should be assigned duties in towns or district headquarters. This comes days after Rahul Bhat, an employee belonging to the community, was killed in Budgam.

295.title: Death toll due to Assam floods rises to 9, over 6 lakh affected in 27 districts
295.article_body: At least nine people have lost their lives so far due to the floods in Assam, the state Disaster Management Authority said. More than 6.62 lakh people in 27 districts of Assam have been affected by the floods and landslides, it added. Around 48,000 people have taken shelter in 135 relief camps in different districts of the state.

296.title: None of the star kids I've worked with made me feel like an outsider: Tara
296.article_body: When asked how she feels working with star kids, actress Tara Sutaria said, "Most of my films are with star kids from earlier generation actors only. It's not right to keep tagging them as star kids." "I feel doing so is really very unfair. None of these actors I've worked with ever made me feel like an outsider," she added.

297.title: Inter-state drug cartel busted in Delhi, heroin worth ₹20 cr seized
297.article_body: Delhi Police's Special Cell recently busted an inter-state drug cartel by arresting an active member of the syndicate. Acting on a tip-off, the accused, identified as Rajesh Gupta, was arrested from Deen Dayal Upadhyay Marg when he was on his way to supply the consignment to different parts of Delhi. Police also seized heroin worth ₹20 crore from him.

298.title: Gautam Gambhir's angry celebration after LSG's 2-run win over KKR goes viral
298.article_body: LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir's angry celebration after his team's two-run victory against KKR has gone viral. Gambhir was seen banging the table after Rinku Singh's wicket on the second-last ball of the last over. After LSG clinched the win by dismissing Umesh Yadav on the last ball, Gambhir was seen screaming and hugging his colleagues in an animated manner.

299.title: We have no money to buy petrol, do not wait in queues at pumps: Sri Lanka to citizens
299.article_body: Sri Lanka currently has no money to pay for petrol shipments, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera told parliament as he appealed to people to stop queuing at fuel pumps. A petrol shipment has been at Colombo port since March 28 but the government has been unable to pay, he added. "We are working to find funds," he further said.

300.title: Tesla cut from S&P 500 ESG Index, Musk says 'ESG is a scam'
300.article_body: The S&P 500 removed Tesla from its ESG Index as part of an annual update citing issues including claims of racial discrimination and poor working conditions at Tesla. Responding to the exclusion, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "ESG is a scam. It has been weaponised by phoney social justice warriors." "S&P Global Ratings has lost their integrity," he added.

301.title: Class 12 student stabs girlfriend's classmate for talking to her near Hyd
301.article_body: A class 12 student allegedly stabbed his girlfriend's classmate for talking to her near Hyderabad in Ranga Reddy's Rajendranagar Mandal in Telangana, police said. "After the accused came to know that his girlfriend is talking to her classmate, he called the victim...stabbed him," police added. The victim and the girl were classmates, Banjara Hills Inspector Nageshwar Rao said.

302.title: I can no longer support Democrats, will vote Republican: Elon Musk
302.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that while he voted for Democrats in the past, he will now vote for Republicans. "In the past I voted Democrat, because they were (mostly) the kindness party. But they have become the party of division & hate, so I can no longer support them and will vote Republican," he tweeted.

303.title: Bengaluru reports 112 of Karnataka's 122 new COVID-19 cases
303.article_body: Karnataka on Wednesday registered 122 new COVID-19 cases and of these, 112 cases were reported from Bengaluru alone. The city also reported 150 recoveries and one coronavirus-related death during the same period. The number of active cases in Bengaluru now stands at 1,684 with a positivity rate of 0.93%, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP).

304.title: Headmistress arrested for carrying beef to school in Assam
304.article_body: A government school headmistress was booked and arrested for allegedly carrying beef to school for lunch in Assam's Goalpara district. "The school management committee said that she had brought beef to school for lunch and was serving it to some members of the staff, which created a sense of discomfort among them," said a police officer.

305.title: Elon Musk loses $12 billion in a day after he tweets on politics, criticises ESG
305.article_body: Elon Musk lost $12 billion in a day after he took to Twitter to announce his political switch from Democrat to Republican and criticised Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG). Musk remains the world's richest person, with a fortune of around $210 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Musk called Democrats the party of division and hate.

306.title: 52-year-old motor workshop owner shot dead in Delhi's Daryaganj
306.article_body: A 52-year-old motor workshop owner was shot dead in Delhi's Daryaganj by bike-borne assailants on Tuesday night, police said. "The injured had received two gunshots and was rushed to Lok Nayak Hospital where he was declared dead," police added. The victim had gone to urinate before closing the shop and was coming back when the assailants shot him.

307.title: Hyderabad airport wins green award for 5th consecutive year
307.article_body: The Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad has won a silver award for efficient carbon management in the Airports Council International's Green Airports Recognition programme. This is for the fifth consecutive time that the airport has won the award. It was announced in the 15-50 million passengers per annum category in the Asia-Pacific region.

308.title: Thane woman abandons her baby, says 'wanted to start afresh'
308.article_body: A Thane-based woman was arrested for abandoning her 15-day-old baby near a dustbin at Mumbai's Marine Drive, police said. During interrogation, the woman said she was forcefully married to a man twice her age and had run away from his house. She allegedly dumped the baby as she "wanted to start afresh and settle down with someone of her age".

309.title: LSG eliminate KKR from IPL 2022 playoffs race with 2-run win, become 2nd team to advance
309.article_body: LSG defeated KKR by two runs in their final league match of IPL 2022 to become the second team after GT to qualify for the playoffs. With the defeat, KKR have been eliminated from the playoffs race. LSG put up a total of 210/0, with Quinton De Kock scoring 140*(70). KKR were restricted to 208/8 in their 20 overs.

310.title: EU chief proposes up to €9 billion in more aid to Ukraine
310.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday proposed extra aid to Ukraine of up to €9 billion to help the country amid the ongoing Russian invasion. The money would be offered to Ukraine in the form of loans, according to a report. It's time to think about rebuilding Ukraine whenever the war ends, the EU chief said.

311.title: Mahesh Babu trolled over pan masala brand's ad after saying 'Bollywood can't afford me'
311.article_body: Telugu actor Mahesh Babu has been trolled for featuring in a pan masala brand's advertisement from last year alongside Tiger Shroff. This comes after his comments wherein he said "Bollywood can't afford me". "It's funny how #MaheshBabu said that #Bollywood can't afford him. But a pan masala brand can," a person tweeted while another Twitter user called it "double standards".

312.title: Plaque of Aurangzeb must be removed from all areas: Agra Mayor
312.article_body: Agra Mayor Naveen Jain said if there is a plaque of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb or if a road is named after him, it must be removed. "Aurangzeb was a cruel ruler who destroyed Hindu temples and compelled people of the Hindu community to convert to Islam," he said. His comment came after controversy over Akbaruddin Owaisi's visit to Aurangzeb's tomb.

313.title: Greece to end mandatory face mask-wearing in planes & indoor areas
313.article_body: Greece's Health Minister Thanos Plevris on Wednesday said that the country would end the mandatory wearing of face masks in airplanes and indoor public venues from June 1. Plevris, however, added that wearing of masks will remain mandatory in hospitals, nursing homes and urban transport like buses and metro. Greece reported more than 4,000 cases of coronavirus on Wednesday.

314.title: MVA govt has 'murdered' OBC's political reservation: Fadnavis
314.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis criticised the Maha Vikas Aghadi government, saying it has "murdered" the OBC's political reservation in local body polls in Maharashtra. "If Maharashtra had done the 'Triple Test', then the reservation of OBC would have been applicable here too," Fadnavis said. This comes after Supreme Court allowed OBC reservation for local body elections in Madhya Pradesh.

315.title: Politics of dishonesty, betrayal: Cong leader on Hardik's exit
315.article_body: Gujarat AICC in-charge Raghu Sharma criticised Hardik Patel over his resignation from the Congress, calling it "politics of dishonesty, betrayal". Alleging that Patel was in touch with the BJP for the last six months, he said, "He was bad-mouthing BJP in UP, Uttarakhand and Punjab. What happened overnight?" Sharma also claimed that Patel's resignation letter was not drafted by him.

316.title: Minister Ajay Mishra's nephew dies as tree branch falls on him in Lakhimpur
316.article_body: Union Minister Ajay Mishra's 41-year-old nephew Achin Mishra alias Sonu died after a branch of a tree fell on him while he was riding a motorcycle in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri on Wednesday, police said. Some people took him to a hospital, where he was declared dead. The deceased is the son of Ajay Mishra's elder brother.

317.title: Mahesh's 'B'wood can't afford me' remark was innocent statement: Ameesha
317.article_body: Actress Ameesha Patel has reacted to Mahesh Babu's 'Bollywood can't afford me' statement and called it an "innocent statement". "I don't think he meant any harm and it should not be blown out of proportion," she added. "He is very dignified and a lovely person. Mahesh Babu can do no wrong," she concluded. Ameesha and Mahesh had featured in 'Naani'.

318.title: KCR felicitates 110-yr-old environmentalist Saalumarada Thimmakka
318.article_body: A 110-year-old environmentalist, Saalumarada Thimmakka, was felicitated by Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao in Hyderabad, when Thimmakka paid a courtesy visit to him at Pragati Bhavan. "Chief Minister Rao is working very hard for the development of Telangana," Thimmakka said. She also expressed happiness over development in the spheres of agriculture and forestry in Telangana.

319.title: Target's shares crash 26%, on track for their worst day since 1987
319.article_body: The shares of American department store chain Target crashed 26% on Wednesday and were on track to log their worst day since the 1987's 'Black Monday' stock market crash. Target's shares slumped after it reported a 52% drop in profit for Q1 2022. Target also warned of a bigger margin hit this year due to rising fuel and freight costs.

320.title: This is a man who tried to kill me, he's also my husband: Amber on Depp
320.article_body: Amber Heard, while being cross-examined by Johnny Depp's lawyer, was asked if she was scared of him. To this, Amber replied, "This is a man who tried to kill me...it's scary. He's also my husband." While being questioned about the couple's fight in Australia in March 2015, Amber denied assaulting Depp in the country, adding, "I didn't assault Johnny ever."

321.title: World's oldest living man confirmed as 112-year-old from Venezuela, pics released
321.article_body: Juan Vicente Pérez, from Venezuela, has been officially confirmed as the oldest person living (male) at 112 years and 253 days, as of February 4, 2022. He has 11 children, 41 grandchildren, 18 great-grandchildren and 12 great-great-grandchildren. Juan is just days away from his 113th birthday, revealed a post by Guinness World Records.

322.title: Man pleads guilty to killing 5 people in Norway bow-and-arrow attacks
322.article_body: A man on Wednesday pleaded guilty to stabbing five people to death and attempting to kill 11 others with bow and arrow in Norway's Kongsberg in October last year. The 38-year-old attacker, Espen Andersen Braathen, suffered from mental illness at time of attacks and should be sentenced to psychiatric care, prosecutors said. Proceedings in the trial will continue till June.

323.title: Wasn't reacting as producer: Sarah on Chris' alleged sexual misconduct
323.article_body: 'Sex and the City' actress Sarah Jessica Parker revealed she hasn't spoken to co-star Chris Noth since his sexual assault allegations. Asking about her reaction as a producer, she said, "Don't...know if I'm ready to talk about it, but...I wasn't reacting as a producer." "We're deeply saddened to hear the allegations," Sarah and her co-stars had said in a statement.

324.title: Tencent's profit halves in Q1 2022, its worst performance since 2004
324.article_body: China's Tencent said its profit had halved YoY and it recorded no revenue growth in Q1 2022, its worst performance since 2004. Tencent's revenue in Q1 2022 was ¥135.5 billion (₹1,55,959 crore) as compared with ¥135.3 billion (₹1,55,728 crore) in Q1 2021. This comes after China launched a regulatory crackdown last year to reign in influence of large internet firms.

325.title: AAP's CM face in U'khand Assembly polls Ajay Kothiyal quits party
325.article_body: Colonel Ajay Kothiyal (Retired), AAP's CM face in the Uttarakhand Assembly elections that were held in February this year, resigned from the party on Wednesday. He had contested polls from the Gangotri Assembly constituency and joined AAP on April 19 last year. Kothiyal, who shared his resignation letter on Twitter, did not provide any reason for quitting the party.

326.title: Surat Police seize 30 kg of marijuana worth ₹3 lakh, 3 arrested
326.article_body: The Surat Police said that they arrested three youths from Odisha and seized marijuana worth ₹3 lakh from them. The Special Operation Group (SOG) intercepted three youths whose movements were suspicious and upon checking, over 30.35 kg marijuana was found in their luggage. Police said they are trying to find out who they were supposed to deliver the contraband to.

327.title: Head constable arrested for taking bribe of ₹20,000 in MP's Bhind
327.article_body: A head constable posted in Malanpur of Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district was arrested by the Lokayukta police for accepting a bribe of ₹20,000. The head constable, identified as Manish Pachauri, reportedly demanded the bribe from the victim and threatened to implicate him in a false case. After the incident, the victim approached the Lokayukta police and complained.

328.title: Lucknow University prof assaulted after remark on Kashi Vishwanath temple
328.article_body: Lucknow University's Associate Professor RV Chandan was allegedly assaulted by a student on the campus on Wednesday, days after he made "objectionable" comments on Varanasi's Kashi Vishwanath temple. "Karthik Pandey, a student leader, came to me, started hurling abuses and casteist slurs at me and hit me," Chandan said. Pandey was overpowered by guards and handed over to the police.

329.title: ABVP holds protest over SSC recruitment scam in Kolkata
329.article_body: Members of the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) held a protest in Kolkata against the alleged irregularities in the SSC recruitment process and the deteriorating law and order situation in the state. The police used water cannons and barricades to stop the protesters. ABVP further demanded transparency with regards to the SSC recruitment process.

330.title: LSG record the highest opening partnership in IPL history
330.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) on Wednesday recorded the highest-ever opening partnership in IPL history. Quinton De Kock and KL Rahul shared an unbeaten 210-run stand against KKR to set the record. The previous record was held by Jonny Bairstow and David Warner, who shared a 185-run opening stand for SRH against RCB on March 31, 2019.

331.title: Telangana's 'Tree Man' injured in accident on way to water plants
331.article_body: The 'Tree Man' of Telangana, Daripalli Ramaiah, received injuries to his right leg and head after falling on road from his bicycle on his way to water plants on Wednesday. The 85-year-old Padma Shri awardee is in ICU and his condition is stable, doctors said. He is said to have planted over one crore trees.

332.title: ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for families of Morbi wall collapse victims: CM
332.article_body: Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel announced a compensation of ₹4 lakh to the families of the 12 people who died after a wall of a salt factory collapsed in Gujarat's Morbi. "My condolences to the bereaved families," Patel tweeted. Prime Minister Narendra Modi also expressed grief at the loss of lives in the mishap and called the tragedy "heart-rending".

333.title: Cannes-like festival should happen in India: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur
333.article_body: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur said a Cannes-like film festival should be held in India. "The next Cannes is in India because if it's not, then I don't know where Cannes will go. We're the land of stories. The west is plateauing...the east is rising. We're the east, we've to step forward," he stated. "This is a moment of confidence," he added.

334.title: Ukraine's Prez gets standing ovation after his speech at Cannes
334.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday received a standing ovation after he virtually addressed the opening ceremony of the Cannes Film Festival. In his address, Zelenskyy quoted Charlie Chaplin's film 'The Great Dictator', saying, "[Hate] of men will pass and dictators die and...power they took from...people will return to...people." His remarks came amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

335.title: Finland & Sweden to buy weapons together as they apply to join NATO
335.article_body: Finland and Sweden will procure portable firearms and anti-tank weapons together, Finland's defence ministry said on Wednesday. The purchase will include assault rifles, shotguns, missiles, recoilless rifles and arms for personal protection, the ministry added. The announcement comes as both countries handed over their applications to NATO to join the military alliance earlier today.

336.title: 28% GST on casinos, online gaming in final report by Group of Ministers: Report
336.article_body: The Group of Ministers tasked to review the GST levy on casinos, racecourses and online gaming finalised its report that reportedly favours 28% tax on the three services. The final report by the panel led by Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma will be handed over to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in a day or two. Currently, these services attract 18% GST.

337.title: Quinton De Kock smashes 10 sixes in an innings, records highest score of IPL 2022
337.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) opener Quinton De Kock on Wednesday recorded the highest individual score of IPL 2022 by scoring 140*(70) against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). De Kock smashed 10 sixes and 10 fours in his innings. It is also the third-highest individual score in IPL history after Chris Gayle's 175* and Brendon McCullum's 158*.

338.title: Not aware if Shailesh Lodha wants to quit 'Taarak Mehta...': Producer
338.article_body: Producer Asit Modi, in an interview, said that he is not aware that Shailesh Lodha wants to quit 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'. "I've not been informed...If there is any development, I'll surely speak about it," he said. This comes after reports had stated that Shailesh, who plays Taarak, was unhappy with his contract and will be quitting the show.

339.title: List of cities with highest maximum temperature today released
339.article_body: The IMD has released the name of cities that reported more than 43°C on Wednesday. UP's Banda with 46.2°C had the highest maximum temperature, followed by Jhansi's 45.4°C. UP's Prayagraj and Rajasthan's Pilani recorded 45.2°C as maximum temperature and Rajasthan's Churu and MP's Nowgong had 45°C as maximum temperature. Eleven cities recorded maximum temperature between 44°C and 45°C.

340.title: Former soldier, who lost both legs in Afghanistan, climbs 3,560-ft mountain in UK
340.article_body: A former soldier, who lost both his legs while fighting in Afghanistan in 2011, has climbed the highest mountain in Wales. Double amputee Liam King scaled Mount Snowdon, which is 3,560-feet-tall. He made it to the summit in seven hours with fellow veteran Luke Read. "I wanted to prove to myself that I can do it," said Liam.

341.title: Video shows Anil Kapoor dancing in Rajasthan while Jeremy Renner claps
341.article_body: A video of Anil Kapoor dancing in front of schoolchildren in Alwar, Rajasthan has gone viral on social media. 'Avengers' actor Jeremy Renner can be seen clapping to Anil's dance in the video. This comes after pictures of Anil and Jeremy shooting in Rajasthan began circulating on social media. Anil is shooting with Jeremy for series 'Rennervations'.

342.title: Bike taxi driver arrested for following, eve-teasing 24-yr-old woman racer in TN
342.article_body: Police has arrested a 34-year-old bike taxi driver in Chennai for allegedly following and eve-teasing 24-year-old professional motorcycle racer and two-time national champion Nivetha Jessica. She said that Hasan had followed her on his bike for around 10 minutes on May 11. Nivetha added that when she yelled at him, he rode away, shouting, "I will do this again."

343.title: Tribal students protest, demand more colleges in MP's Jabalpur
343.article_body: Tribal students of Bargi constituency of Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur district staged a protest, demanding colleges to be built in Bargi and Chargwan. The students along with Congress MLA Sanjay Yadav reached the commissioner's office and submitted a written memorandum regarding the issue. Many students discontinued their studies after class 12 due to lack of colleges, a student said.

344.title: Russia expels 85 diplomats from European nations in tit-for-tat move
344.article_body: Russian Foreign Ministry on Wednesday announced the expulsion of 85 embassy staff from France, Spain and Italy in response to similar moves by these countries. These three countries are among European nations that have reportedly expelled over 200 Russian diplomats since the country began invading Ukraine in February. Meanwhile, Italian PM Mario Draghi called Russia's announcement a "hostile act".

345.title: Google's Russian subsidiary to file for bankruptcy after account seizure
345.article_body: Google's Russian subsidiary plans to file for bankruptcy after its bank account was seized by authorities, a Google spokesperson said on Wednesday. "Russian authorities' seizure of Google Russia's bank account has made it untenable for our Russia office to function," the spokesperson said. This is the first time that Google said its bank account as a whole has been seized.

346.title: India's richest man enters the healthcare sector with 'Adani Health Ventures'
346.article_body: India's richest man Gautam Adani has entered the healthcare sector with Adani Enterprises' wholly-owned subsidiary 'Adani Health Ventures Limited' (AHVL). "The subsidiary was incorporated on May 17, 2022, to carry on the business of healthcare-related activities," a filing said. The activities include medical and diagnostic facilities, health aids and health tech-based facilities among others.

347.title: 3 Delhi civic bodies unified, to be treated as one from May 22
347.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs on Wednesday issued a notification for the unification of the three civic bodies of Delhi. The South, North and East civic bodies will be treated as one Municipal Corporation of Delhi from May 22. Legislation to unify the civic bodies was approved by Lok Sabha on March 30 and by Rajya Sabha on April 5.

348.title: People queue up in Colombo to get 2-time meals amid economic crisis
348.article_body: Several Sri Lankan citizens, including daily wage labourers, have queued up at Galle Face in Colombo to receive two-time meals from a food trust. "[People] are coming from far away by buses, taxis and train(s)...We provide food to all without...discrimination," a social worker said.
