Sri Lanka is reeling under economic crisis which has triggered a shortage of essentials, including food.

349.title: 21-year-old Russian soldier pleads guilty to killing 62-year-old civilian in Ukraine
349.article_body: A Russian soldier accused of war crimes in Ukraine pleaded guilty on Wednesday to killing a 62-year-old unarmed civilian. Vadim Shishimarin, a 21-year-old Russian tank commander, entered his plea in a Kyiv district court hearing its first war crimes trial since Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. If convicted, he faces up to life imprisonment.

350.title: AIMIM leader held over derogatory post on 'Shivling' inside Gyanvapi Mosque
350.article_body: Gujarat AIMIM leader Danish Qureshi was arrested by the Ahmedabad Police on Wednesday for making derogatory remarks on Twitter on the 'Shivling' found inside the Gyanvapi Mosque complex. Qureshi was arrested after Hindu organisations made a representation before the police. "We carried out a technical analysis of the Twitter handle and arrested Qureshi," said ACP (Crime Branch) JM Yadav.

351.title: Can we call ourselves democracy: DK Shivakumar on Panchayat polls
351.article_body: KPCC president DK Shivakumar held the Karnataka government responsible for the "non-conduct of Panchayat elections". He also expressed concerns regarding Karnataka State Election Commission's urgent petition in the High Court. "When the Election Commission itself says the government has taken away its powers, can we call ourselves a democracy?" he questioned.

352.title: Mumbai Naval officer asked to fill KYC details, cheated of ₹1 lakh
352.article_body: The Mumbai police have registered a case against an unidentified person after a senior Naval officer was cheated of ₹1 lakh. The complaint said the officer received a text message with a link asking him to complete his KYC formalities. As the officer entered his bank details, the accused transferred ₹1 lakh to his own account, a police officer said.

353.title: 13-year-old girl raped by relative in Pune, case registered
353.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her relative in Pune's Lonikand. Reports say that the accused, a distant relative of the victim, ran away from the scene after he committed the crime. The accused raped the minor when she was alone at home, reports stated. The police have registered a case under relevant sections of IPC and POCSO Act.

354.title: Cleanliness drive launched around Navi Mumbai's Ballaleshwar Lake
354.article_body: In a joint effort by NGO Robin Hood Army and the Rotaract club of Panvel Industrial Town, a cleanliness drive was launched around Ballaleshwar Lake, which is Panvel's oldest lake. Volunteers said that the waste mostly constituted of single-use plastic. The aim is to encourage people to reduce, reuse and recycle non-biodegradable substances, a volunteer said.

355.title: Don't line up for petrol, we can't buy it: Sri Lankan govt to citizens
355.article_body: Sri Lankan government on Wednesday urged citizens to not line up to buy petrol as the country doesn't have foreign exchange to pay for it. Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera told parliament that payment for a previous shipment of petrol worth $53 million is also pending. Earlier, Sri Lankan PM had said that the country was left with limited petrol stocks.

356.title: Jury shown knife actress Amber Heard gave actor Johnny Depp in 2012
356.article_body: The jury was shown a knife which was gifted by actress Amber Heard to actor Johnny Depp in 2012. Amber had alleged that Depp began abusing her in 2011 before a break in 2012. Depp's lawyer asked Amber, "That's the knife...you gave to the man who was abusing you?" To this, Amber replied, "I wasn't afraid of him stabbing me."

357.title: Rahul preferred choice of party workers to be Cong chief: Tharoor
357.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said that there remains no doubt that his party colleague Rahul Gandhi would be the preferred choice of an overwhelming majority of party workers to be Congress chief. However, he added that Rahul has not indicated whether he wants the job. His comments come days after the Congress organised a three-day 'Chintan Shivir' in Rajasthan.

358.title: Pak woman lost during Partition meets Indian brothers after 75 yrs at Kartarpur
358.article_body: A woman who was separated from her family during Partition met her brothers from India at Kartarpur in Pakistan's Punjab province after 75 years. Mumtaz Bibi was born in a Sikh family and was raised by a Muslim couple in Pakistan. She got to know about her real family two years ago and got connected with them through social media.

359.title: Rajasthan Congress MLA Ganesh Ghogra resigns from his seat, says 'was being ignored'
359.article_body: Congress MLA from Rajasthan's Dungarpur, Ganesh Ghogra, resigned from his seat on Wednesday. He is also the president of the state Youth Congress. Ghogra said he was being ignored despite being an MLA of the ruling party in the state. He added that the administration doesn't listen when he brings up people's concerns.

360.title: Bengaluru-based Grammy winner Ricky Kej repeats his Grammy outfit at Cannes
360.article_body: US-born Indian music composer Ricky Kej, who has lived in Bengaluru since he was eight, repeated his Grammy Awards outfit at the Cannes Film Festival. Two-time Grammy award-winner, Kej, took to Instagram to share his pictures from both the events and wrote, "Fashion can be trendy twice." Citing pollution from the fashion industry, he added, "Fast fashion isn't always fashionable."

361.title: ITC reports 11.7% YoY rise in net profit to ₹4,196 crore in Q4
361.article_body: FMCG giant ITC Limited on Wednesday reported an 11.7% YoY rise in consolidated net profit at ₹4,196 crore in Q4 FY22, against ₹3,755 crore reported in Q4 FY21. Consolidated revenue for Q4 FY22 came in at ₹17,754 crore, a 15.3% YoY rise from ₹15,404 crore. ITC's consolidated PAT and revenue for FY22 jumped to ₹15,243 crore and ₹65,205 crore respectively.

362.title: Landmines explode along LoC due to forest fire in J&K
362.article_body: A forest fire has triggered several landmine explosions along the LoC in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district, officials said on Wednesday. The landmines were part of the anti-infiltration obstacle system. "The forest fire has been raging for the past three days...This morning it started in Daramshal block and spread fast due to powerful winds," Forester Kanar Hussain Shah said.

363.title: Heroism is working again: Bhushan Kumar on success of South films
363.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, speaking about the recent success of South films, said, "They're pure entertainers. They have music, action, heroism, the mother element, the way it used to be in our 90s films." "They are presenting it at a high scale...it's working," he stated while adding that people won't watch scaled-down mass entertainers. "Heroism is working again," he concluded.

364.title: Ukraine 'lacks will' to continue peace talks: Russia
364.article_body: Russia has accused Ukraine of not wanting to continue talks to end hostilities amid the ongoing conflict between the two nations. "Talks are indeed not moving forward and we note...complete lack of will of Ukrainian negotiators to continue this process," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. This comes after Kyiv's negotiator Mykhailo Podolyak said that talks with Moscow were "on hold".

365.title: TN CM hails Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict's release from jail
365.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin reacted to release of Perarivalan, one of the convicts in ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, praising verdict for serving as an example of India's federalism. "Congratulations...to Perarivalan for fully breathing...the air of liberation [after over] 30 years of [jail]," he tweeted. Stalin also praised Perarivalan's mother for her perseverance during his imprisonment.

366.title: Battery car services to Vaishno Devi shrine suspended for the day
366.article_body: The battery car services to the Vaishno Devi shrine were suspended on the new track on Wednesday due to a forest fire in the Trikuta hills. However, the pilgrimage continued through the traditional track. The fire broke out near the Sanji Chhat helipad in the forest area of Trikuta hills on late Sunday evening.

367.title: World's tallest building Burj Khalifa vanishes in a layer of dust amid sandstorm
367.article_body: The world's tallest building Burj Khalifa disappeared behind a grey layer of dust today as sandstorms that have swept the Middle East hit the United Arab Emirates, prompting weather and traffic warnings. Capital city Abu Dhabi's air quality index (AQI) soared into the "hazardous" zone overnight. Authorities issued a nationwide warning urging residents to remain vigilant.

368.title: Nikhat reaches final at Women's World Boxing Championships; Manisha, Parveen win bronze
368.article_body: Indian boxer Nikhat Zareen defeated Brazil's Caroline De Almeida to enter the 52-kg category final at the Women's World Boxing Championships. Meanwhile, Manisha Moun bagged a bronze medal after losing in the semi-final against Tokyo Olympics bronze medallist Irma Testa. In the 63-kg category, Parveen Hooda bagged a bronze after losing to European Championships bronze medallist Amy Broadhurst.

369.title: LSG to bat first against KKR in their last league stage match, make 3 changes
369.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bat first against KKR in their last league stage clash in IPL 2022 on Wednesday. LSG have made three changes to their playing XI, with Manan Vohra, Evin Lewis and Krishnappa Gowtham replacing Ayush Badoni, Dushmantha Chameera and Krunal Pandya. KKR have replaced Ajinkya Rahane with Abhijeet Tomar.

370.title: India looks a lot like Sri Lanka: Rahul on graphs comparing economies
370.article_body: Congress' Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday accused the Centre of failing to curb inflation and employment crisis in the country and stated that "India looks a lot like Sri Lanka". Gandhi took to Twitter to share graphs comparing both countries' statistics on unemployment, petrol prices and communal violence. Notably, Sri Lanka is undergoing its worst economic crisis since its independence.

371.title: It deeply saddens us: Congress on Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict's release
371.article_body: After the Supreme Court ordered release of AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "The decision...deeply saddens us." "If those guilty of terrorism and assassination of a PM are going to be released like this, then who'll uphold the majesty and the integrity of law in this country," he asked.

372.title: Punjab govt agrees to farmers' demand on advancing paddy sowing
372.article_body: The Punjab government on Wednesday accepted the demands raised by the Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) by agreeing to advance the paddy transplantation in three phases beginning June 7. The earlier schedule of paddy transplantation consisted of four phases starting June 18. The government also agreed to buy moong (green grams) at MSP, for which the mandis have been identified.

373.title: I am leaving Twitter, it's not because of Elon: Twitter VP of Product Management
373.article_body: Ilya Brown, one of Twitter's latest three senior executives to leave Twitter, tweeted, "Yes, I'm leaving Twitter. No, it is not because of Elon or uncertainty inside the company." Ilya Brown, Twitter's Vice President of Product Management, said, "It has been an amazing six years and I've loved every second of it." Ilya added, "I will forever love this place."

374.title: Open to the idea of Chris Rock hosting Oscars 2023: ABC President
374.article_body: ABC President of Entertainment Craig Erwich has said that they are open to the idea of Chris Rock hosting the Academy Awards in 2023. This comes after actor Will Smith slapped Chris Rock during the 2022 event. "There was a...controversy, which overshadowed a lot of...positive things about the show, but I was really happy with the program," Craig said.

375.title: Pune's new art centre 'Zapurza' to be inaugurated on May 19
375.article_body: An all-inclusive art point named 'Zapurza' is set to be inaugurated in Pune on Thursday. The centre, which was reportedly under construction for four years, will house as many as eight galleries, an amphitheatre, an auditorium and will display various artworks from locations including Mumbai and Kolhapur. Additionally, there will be two separate galleries dedicated to jewellery and textiles.

376.title: Hyd Police arrests university VC in fake educational certificates scam
376.article_body: Hyderabad Police has arrested the vice-chancellor of Bhopal's Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan University in connection with a fake educational certificates scam. A former vice-chancellor has also been arrested. In February, four cases were registered against a few educational consultants and the management of the university for allegedly providing educational certificates in return for money.

377.title: Railway employee crushed to death by train in Gr Noida: Police
377.article_body: A 33-year-old railway employee died on duty after being run over by a train in Greater Noida on Wednesday morning, police said. The deceased, identified as Sunil Kumar Verma, was working on the rail track segment near Dadri when he got hit by the train, police added. Verma was reportedly working with the railway as technician grade one (signal).

378.title: I've to breathe: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict on release from jail after 31 yrs
378.article_body: AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, was released from jail after 31 years on the order of the Supreme Court today. As he stepped out, Perarivalan told reporters, "I have just come out...I've to breathe a bit. Give me some time." He further said he firmly believes "there's no need for capital punishment".

379.title: ₹25,000 aid will be given for rain-hit houses in B'luru: K'taka CM
379.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has announced that a compensation of ₹25,000 would be given each to those whose houses have been flooded and affected due to heavy rains in Bengaluru. Furthermore, Bommai also announced a compensation of ₹5 lakh each for the families of the two labourers who died due to heavy rainfall at a pipeline work site in Bengaluru.

380.title: I have the honour of having the most-liked tweet of any living human: Musk
380.article_body: Elon Musk said, "I have the honour of having the most-liked tweet of any living human. Thank you everyone for liking my tweet." Musk said that his tweet, "Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in," has over 4.8 million likes. Notably, the tweet announcing actor Chadwick Boseman's death is the most-liked ever, with over 7.1 million likes.

381.title: Protesting farmers to meet Punjab CM to discuss their demands
381.article_body: A group of protesting Punjab farmers on Wednesday said they'll meet CM Bhagwant Mann to discuss their demands. "[Deputy Commissioner] and SSP came to take us (for the meeting) and...message (for the meeting) is from CM sahab," said farmer leader Baldev Singh Sirsa. This comes after farmers protested near the Chandigarh-Mohali border on Tuesday after being stopped from entering Chandigarh.

382.title: Tata Consumer Products in talks to acquire as many as 5 brands
382.article_body: Tata Consumer Products (TCP), the food and beverage arm of Tata Group, is in talks to acquire as many as five consumer brands. A "significant amount" of the Mumbai-based firm's future growth will come from inorganic expansion, TCP CEO Sunil D'Souza said. "We're reaching out to potential targets to have a chat to see if there is interest," D'Souza added.

383.title: BJP creating communal issues to divert attention from price hike: Mamata
383.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday alleged, "The Narendra Modi government is engineering communal disturbances to divert the attention of the common people." She accused the Centre of looting the common people by hiking the prices of domestic gas, petrol and diesel. Banerjee was addressing a party programme at Midnapore College ground.

384.title: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal resigns: Reports
384.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal has submitted his resignation to President Ram Nath Kovind, citing personal reasons, according to reports. He was appointed as the Delhi Lieutenant Governor in December, 2016 after Najeeb Jung had resigned from the post. He had previously served as the Union Home Secretary.

385.title: Video shows white man urinating on black student's books, laptop in SA; students protest
385.article_body: Students have launched protests at South Africa's Stellenbosch University after a video showing a white student urinating on a black student's personal belongings, including books and laptop, surfaced online. The accused, who has been identified as 25-year-old Theuns Du Toit, has been suspended. "It's a White thing, boy," Du Toit reportedly told the student after urinating on his things.

386.title: 959 Ukrainian fighters in Mariupol surrendered so far: Russia
386.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry said 694 Ukrainian fighters who'd been holed up in Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks, last bastion of Ukrainian resistance in the city, have surrendered over the past 24 hours. So far, 959 soldiers at the plant have handed themselves over to Russian troops, it added. Ukraine has offered to release Russian prisoners of war in exchange for Mariupol fighters.

387.title: K'taka HC quashes BBMP's demand of ₹69 lakh from 150-year-old school
387.article_body: The Karnataka High Court quashed Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) notice demanding ₹69 lakh from 150-year-old Good Shepherd Convent school and said that the demand has "no legal legs to stand". In 2014, the school made application to BBMP seeking licence to construct four additional floors and paid ₹1,61,438 as scrutiny fee but BBMP demanded ₹69 lakh as betterment charge.

388.title: I competed with myself in bettering what I did last: Jaaved on his projects
388.article_body: Speaking about his career choices, Jaaved Jaaferi said, "I wanted to be happy with what I was doing. Most of the work I did, I did connect to it but sometimes you do things as you need to do it." "I...competed with myself in bettering what I did last," he added. Jaaved further said now he wants to do better.

389.title: People within Cong have no faith in party: Owaisi on Hardik Patel's exit
389.article_body: Reacting to Hardik Patel's departure from Congress ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that those within Congress don't have any faith in party. "Congress ruled Maharashtra for 15 years but now...party has slipped to third position...Congress is nowhere to be seen in Delhi," he added. Patel resigned as working president of Congress' Gujarat unit earlier today.

390.title: No matter what size you are, people will discuss it: Sonakshi on body shaming
390.article_body: During an interview, actress Sonakshi Sinha said both she and actress Huma Qureshi have faced body and weight-shaming for years during the initial years of their careers. "It happened from the beginning of our careers in this line and it still happens. It hasn't stopped," she added. "No matter what size you are, people are always discussing it," Sonakshi said.

391.title: Rahul Tripathi should be in the mix for Team India: Ravi Shastri
391.article_body: Ex-India coach Ravi Shastri has said SRH batter Rahul Tripathi is "not far" from receiving an India call-up. He added, "If someone gets injured, this guy can be slotted in straight away...Rahul Tripathi is a dangerous player and should be in the mix." Shastri further said, "If he's performing season after season, I'm sure the selectors will be watching."

392.title: It is good that Hardik Patel left the party: Gujarat Cong incharge
392.article_body: Gujarat Congress incharge Raghu Sharma on Wednesday said it was good that Hardik Patel left the party as Patel's personal ambitions were larger than Congress' ideology. Sharma said Hardik was insecure of losing his space in the party if Rajkot-based businessman Naresh Patel joined the party. Hardik resigned from Congress' primary membership on Wednesday.

393.title: ITBP rescues 2 trekkers, stranded for over 48 hours in U'khand
393.article_body: A team of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) rescued two trekkers, who were stranded for over 48 hours, during an expedition in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh, a senior officer said on Wednesday. Vishal Gangwar and Santosh Kumar started their trek to Khaliya Top on Sunday and got stranded near Birthi fall in Munsiyari. They are being brought to safety through land route.

394.title: Big mistake: Mackie on Kim Kardashian wearing Marilyn Monroe's gown
394.article_body: Designer Bob Mackie, speaking about Kim Kardashian wearing Marilyn Monroe's gown at Met Gala, said, "I thought it was a big mistake." "[Marilyn] was a goddess. A crazy goddess, but a goddess...it was done for her. It was designed for her. Nobody else should be seen in that dress," he added. Kim had worn Marilyn's original 1962 Jean Louis gown.

395.title: Kareena is very polite & down to earth: Chef who cooked for her in Kalimpong
395.article_body: Kareena Kapoor, who has been shooting in Kalimpong for Sujoy Ghosh's 'Devotion of Suspect X', posted stories about a bakery in the hills named Neena's Kitchen. She tagged one of the dishes as the "best meal ever" and also praised the dessert. Reacting to it, chef Neena who cooked for her said, "Kareena is very polite and down to earth."

396.title: 19-yr-old man enters 13-yr-old relative's house, rapes her in Pune; booked
396.article_body: Pune Police have booked a 19-year-old man for allegedly raping his 13-year-old relative. According to police, the accused and the victim stay in the same neighbourhood. The FIR based on the complaint filed, said that the man entered the girl's house when her family was away and took advantage of the absence of her family.

397.title: Bhagyashree breaks down at son Abhimanyu's 'Nikamma' trailer launch
397.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree got emotional at the trailer launch of her son Abhimanyu Dassani's film 'Nikamma'. She added, "He has put a lot of effort into this film. The shooting of this film...went on for two years during COVID-19." "He has done...[a] good work [and]...worked so hard...Just keep this nikamma in your heart," Bhagyashree said.

398.title: Heart-rending: PM Modi after 12 die in Guj wall collapse incident
398.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday condoled the loss of lives after 12 labourers were killed when a wall of a factory collapsed in the Morbi district of Gujarat. Taking to Twitter, PM Modi said, "The tragedy in Morbi caused by a wall collapse is heart-rending." He further announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the families of the deceased.

399.title: Special arrangements made for animals at Tanday Deer Park amid rising heat
399.article_body: Special arrangements have been made for the animals at Tanday Rakh and Mantalai Deer Park in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur during summer. "With the prolonged dry spell and forest fires, we ensure to enrich their diet; provide watermelon, cucumber, agro-feed, green fodder and 24-hour water supply," a forest guard said. "We sprinkle water in sheds to cool them," he added.

400.title: Taliban ask female UN staffers to wear hijab, say will monitor
400.article_body: The Taliban-led government of Afghanistan has reportedly issued a statement asking female staff members of the UN Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA) to wear hijab. The Ministry of Propagation of Virtue and Prevention of Vice said that its personnel will stand outside the UNAMA office to monitor if the women are wearing hijab or not.

401.title: Will retain neutral status: Austria after Sweden-Finland NATO bid
401.article_body: Austrian Foreign Minister Alexander Schallenberg said Austria would retain its neutral status even as Sweden and Finland overhauled decades-long foreign policy stances to apply for NATO membership amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Schallenberg added that Austria, which obtains 80% of its natural gas from Russia, would continue to provide humanitarian support to Ukraine rather than lethal weapons.
